titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the W. W. Morrison Papers, 1804-1977
titlestmt.author: Processed by D.C. Thompson

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Mark Shelstad March 2006

titlepage.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: Maps, photographs, diaries, transcripts, research notes, and other materials relating to emigration on the Overland Trails in the U.S. West.

bioghist.head: Biography of W.W. Morrison
bioghist.p: William Wayne Morrison (1898-1977) was passenger agent of the Union Pacific Railroad and also a historian of emigrant trails and pioneer graves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains materials collected by Morrison for his research on emigrant trails and grave sites in the Western United States. Included are transcripts of diaries and narratives of emigrants, photographs of gravesites, research materials, and secondary sources.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by W. W. Morrison at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Received from W.W. Morrison in July 1986.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by D.C. Thompson in 1986.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, W. W. Morrison Collection, Collection Number 323, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.

controlaccess.subject: Railroads
Immigration and American Expansion
Overland Journeys to the Western United States
Pioneers

did.unittitle: Paperweights, Pattison grave stone replicas, rock

did.abstract: William Wayne Morrison, b. April 8, 1898-d. March 7, 1977; telegrapher, freight and passenger agent for Union Pacific in Wyoming; historian of emigrant trails and pioneer graves

did.unittitle: Morrison Family genealogical research and real estate matters; includes correspondence, photocopies of legal documents, etc., 1884-1972,
School & Personal, includes graduation programs, draft cards, newspaper clippings, biographical articles, etc., 1914-1976,
Employment & Financial, includes correspondence, employment contracts, schedules, employment history, bank records, 1914-1967,
Membership cards, licenses and railroad passes of W.W. Morrison, Mildred Leachman Morrison (wife) and Wayne, Weldon and Wanda Morrison, 1920-1975,
Union Pacific employment, letters of commendation and appreciation, 1925-1957,
Personal, copies of letters from Morrison to friends and family members regarding his activities, 1969-1977,
Miscellaneous, letters to and from Ruth Louise Johnson, Caroline Bancroft, various historical societies, etc., 1930-1978,
Post Cards, picturing Ohio, Wyoming and the west, Europe, Hawaii and New Zealand, some with messages, 1900-1974,

Horse Shoe Station to Deer Creek: Bridger Ferry; Indian Wars; LaBonte; Fort Fetterman; graves of J. Hembree, C.B. Platt, etc.

Fort Casper: Platte Bridge fight; Custard and Collins Massacres; Platte River crossings, etc.
Fort Casper to Sweetwater: Platte Bridge; Independence Rock; graves of Rachel Morgan and others; Devil's Gate, etc.
Sweetwater: Independence Rock; Devil's Gate; South Pass; graves of T.P. Baker, Jo Barnette and Mrs. Bryan; Cattle Kate lynching, etc.
Sweetwater to Green River: Pacific Springs; Sublette Cutoff; South Pass; Green River ferry, etc.
Green River to Fort Boise: Fort Hall; Indian massacres, etc.
Fort Boise to Columbia River: grave of Jane Hobart; Wallowa Lake; Chief Joseph; Whitman Mission, etc.
Columbia River, Oregon and Washington; graves of Frances Keeney; Astoria; the Dalles and Cascades; Mount Hood; missions and early explorations, etc.
Overland Trail, primarily Wyoming and Colorado: Virginia Dale; Jack Slade; graves, etc., 1945-1973
Lodgepole Creek Trail, Nebraska and Southeastern Wyoming: graves of Emly Patrick; Sherman Station and Sherman Hill; Union Pacific route, etc., 1945-1973
Deadwood Trail, Wyoming and South Dakota: ranches, etc., 1947
Blue Bucket Mine Trail (Meek Cutoff), Oregon: grave of Mrs. S. Chambers; Lost Wagon Train, etc., 1947-1948
Barlow Road, Oregon: also Oregon Territory Centennial, 1947-1950
Vancouver to Olympia, Washington: Indians and Indian battles; early exploration; Talcott family, etc., 1945-1973
